result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Austin Sweeney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Psilocin (>500 g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(g)3.
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>10,000 g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)5.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 3; credit for 6 days time served

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

- Not to reside or be present where illegal drugs are present in any building and or vehicle.
- NO CONTACT with Anthony C.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.

timeConds.notes: STAYED; for use by agent; as to both counts concurrent

records.addlTxt:
Order on Motion To Seal or Redact a Court Record.
The original document was titled: State's Sentencing Memorandum.pdf
The original history event date is: 09-27-2022

Defendant Steven Austin Sweeney in court.  Attorney John A. Chavez in court for Steven Austin Sweeney.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
 Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. PSI reviewed and corrections made.

AS TO COUNT 2: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, concurrent TO COUNT 3, credit for 6 DAYS time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 3: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, concurrent TO COUNT 2, credit for 6 DAYS time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- Serve 45 days condition time in the House of Correction; Stayed for use by agent, as to both counts concurrent. 
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- Not to reside or be present where illegal drugs are present in any building and or vehicle.
- No contact with Anthony C.

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.


*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, 
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Character letters to the Court for Defendant, filed.
Court received letter regarding withdraw of petition of property and removes hearing.
Letter to the Court.
Return of property hearing on August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Milwaukee Police Department Inventory # 22001723-2

Defendant Steven Austin Sweeney in court with attorney John A. Chavez.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:
The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

**Court ordered a presentence investigation without a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.*** 
 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. Next hearing to be held in person.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights

Defendant Steven Austin Sweeney in court with attorney John A. Chavez.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense requests more time. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Order for Continuance.
Stipulation for Continuance.

Defendant Steven Austin Sweeney in court with attorney John A. Chavez.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven Austin Sweeney appeared by video means with Attorney. Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests projected plea and sentencing date. State does not object. Court orders plea papers filed before hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant Steven Austin Sweeney in court with Attorney John A. Chavez; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven Austin Sweeney in court with attorney John A. Chavez.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven Austin Sweeney appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case in court for status of counsel. Defense advises retained for case. Court finds that cause was found to extend time limits for prelim hearing for status of counsel. Case adjourned to prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven Austin Sweeney in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Any cash bail previously posted to be returned to the poster. All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant Steven Austin Sweeney in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Steven Austin Sweeney in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE RECALLED AT THE REQUEST OF THE COMMISSIONER. Court converts the cash bail to a signature bond. All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Any previous posted bail to apply.

Defendant Steven Austin Sweeney in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Steven Austin Sweeney in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
